title: Software Developer III
description: Full-stack software development in the Accruals Processing Team powering Paycom’s Accruals Module.
bullets: Delivered new accrual features while balancing maintenance, bug fixes, and security patches.
Collaborated with Product, QA, AppSec, DevOps, DBA, and Support to validate requirements and releases.
Resolved client-flagged production issues under an 8-hour SLA during Research Rotation, updating runbooks and ensuring client transparency.
Remediated high-priority security vulnerabilities across microservices and SPAs.
Balanced ~50% workload on new development and ~50% on maintenance/bug fixes.
Progressed tickets across SDLC: unit tests, build pipelines, container testing, integration, regression, and deployment.
Enforced quality gates with code reviews, automated regression tests, and QA validation.

title: Software Development Intern
description: Designed and delivered the Drip Campaign Tool, automating recruiter outreach to 300,000+ candidates.
bullets: Designed and delivered the Drip Campaign Tool, reducing setup steps by 80% and saving recruiters 90 minutes per campaign.
Partnered with recruiters to translate workflows into requirements and user flows.
Led integration with the Alumni Portal team via a live join in the microservice.
Implemented privacy-first tracking with hashed IDs and GDPR/CCPA consent checks.
Built .NET Core Web API backend with EF + Dapper, powering campaign setup and analytics.
Built React frontend with reusable components and streamlined templates.
Organized and led 8 Clean Code sessions to improve code quality.

title: Software Development Intern
description: Built a multi-threaded querying tool for 6,000+ employees, cutting query times by 65%.
bullets: Implemented multi-threaded query execution in C#, enabling parallel shard requests across 200+ databases.
Developed persistent query history system for one-click re-execution.
Built client-side results table with server-side pagination, handling 100k+ rows.
Delivered React dashboard with a multi-step query builder and results viewer.
Developed .NET Core Web API endpoints with async/await and Dapper.
Won Paycom’s annual Code-A-Thon (1st place, 12 teams).

title: Campus Ambassador
description: Promoted Paycom’s Intern & New Grad programs to UTCS students.
bullets: Raised awareness of Paycom opportunities at UT Austin.
Reached 2,000+ students through events and networking.
